com.worldpay

Class CardValidationError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.worldpay.CardValidationError

  • public class CardValidationError
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a list of card validation errors, using error codes.

    Usage :

    • To check if the card contains any error : hasErrors()
    • To check if there is a specific error : hasError(int)
    • To get a description for an error : getDescription(int)

    Card.validate() returns this class in order to specify validation errors. An example: 

     
 CardValidationError validationError = card.validate();
 
 if (validationError != null) {
        //we have errors
        if (validationError.hasError(CardValidationError.ERROR_CARD_EXPIRY)) {
                //something is wrong with the expiry date 
        }
        if (validationError.hasError(CardValidationError.ERROR_HOLDER_NAME)) {
                //something is wrong with the holder name 
        }
        // etc ... 
 
 }

    Possible error values

    • ERROR_CARD_EXPIRY
    • ERROR_CVC
    • ERROR_HOLDER_NAME
    • ERROR_CARD_NUMBER
